description: This Dart source file defines an API client class, ApiClient, which wraps backend HTTP endpoints for user authentication, class data retrieval, attendance marking, and attendance data fetching. It includes methods for interacting with various REST API endpoints, handling JSON encoding/decoding, and managing HTTP headers with optional authorization tokens.

classes.name: ApiClient
classes.description: A client class for interacting with backend API endpoints, handling login, fetching classes, students, attendance, and disposal of HTTP client resources.

methods.name: ApiClient
methods.description: Constructor for ApiClient, allowing optional injection of an HTTP client for dependency injection or testing.

methods.name: baseUrl
methods.description: Getter that retrieves the base URL for API calls from environment variables.

methods.name: _headers
methods.description: Utility method to generate HTTP headers with content type and optional authorization token.

methods.name: login
methods.description: Authenticates a user with email and password, returning a UserModel object upon success.

methods.name: getClasses
methods.description: Fetches a list of classes available to the current user, requiring an authorization token.

methods.name: getStudents
methods.description: Fetches a list of students in a specified class, requiring an authorization token and class ID.

methods.name: markAttendance
methods.description: Marks attendance for a class based on a provided request object, requiring an authorization token.

methods.name: getToday
methods.description: Fetches today's attendance data for a specific class, requiring an authorization token.

methods.name: getWeekly
methods.description: Retrieves weekly attendance aggregate data for a class, requiring an authorization token.

methods.name: dispose
methods.description: Closes the HTTP client instance to free resources.
